business.headline: Mutual funds are on the rise again. Check out these 5 bets in 2025Choosing the right mutual fund depends on how much risk you're comfortable with and how long you plan to invest.

Oyo delays IPO attempt for 3rd time as largest shareholder opposes: ReportIndia's Nifty 50 index has risen about 3% in 2025 so far, but it's still over 7% below its all-time high from October last year. This market volatility has affected several companies.

UPI witnesses small dip in April, but yearly growth remains strongAccording to data from the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI processed 17.89 billion transactions in April, which is about 2.2% less than March's 18.30 billion.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".
Sensex ends 260 points higher, Nifty above 24,300; Adani Ports gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 259.75 points to close at 80,501.99, while the NSE Nifty50 ended just 12.50 points higher at 24,346.70.
Zoho halts $700 million chip manufacturing plan. Here's whyZoho, started in 1996, is known for offering affordable business software and services to companies around the world.

Vizhinjam port inaugurated: What makes it a strategic gem for IndiaThe Vizhinjam port has a natural sea depth of around 20 metres, making it suitable for very large ships without the need for deep digging, which is common in other ports.

UPI payments to get faster from June 16: What it means for youNPCI shared in its latest circular stated that from June 16, 2025, UPI users can expect quicker responses when checking the status of a transaction or reversing a payment.

Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.

Zomato shares rise despite 78% drop in Q4 profit. Should you buy, hold or sell?Eternal posted revenue of Rs 5,830 crore, broadly in line with analyst estimates. EBITDA margin slipped to 1.2%—falling short of expectations—but the company managed to maintain stable contribution margins in both food delivery and quick commerce.
Adani Group stocks rise up to 5%. Here's whyAdani Enterprises' shares climbed more than 2% on Friday after the company reported an increase in its net profit for the January–March quarter.
Sensex gains 900 points. 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 867.48 points at 81,109.72 around 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 247.90 points to trade at 24,582.10.

entertainment.headline: She lived a full, joyful life: Boney Kapoor's statement after mother Nirmal's deathBoney Kapoor shared an emotional note in the wee hours of Saturday and mourned the death of his mother, Nirmal Kapoor. She was survived by four children- Boney, Anil, Sanjay, and Reena Kapoor.

Heidi Gardner and Bobby Ray join star-packed cast of Ferrell's 'Judgment Day'Heidi Gardner and golfer Bobby Ray join Will Ferrell and Zac Efron in Amazon MGM's comedy Judgment Day, directed by Nicholas Stoller. The film follows a convict hijacking a courtroom show.

Gal Gadot and Matthias Schoenaerts to star in WW II thriller 'Ruin' from Niki CaroGal Gadot and Matthias Schoenaerts will star in Ruin, a WWII revenge thriller directed by Niki Caro. Filming begins in 2026, with international sales launched at Cannes Film Market.

Ed Sheeran's 'Play' album out in September, draws Persian and Indian influencesEd Sheeran has announced his new album Play, out September 12, with the release of "Old Phone." The globally inspired album was finalized in India and features Persian and Indian sounds.

Complaint against Sonu Nigam for 'provocative' remarks at Bengaluru concertA Kannada outfit has accused Sonu Nigam of stoking "linguistic enmity" at a Bengaluru concert over the singer's remarks linking a fan's Kannada song request to the Pahalgam terror attack.

From music to filmmaking: Create in India Challenge awards winners at WAVES 2025The Waves Create in India Challenge Awards, in partnership with India Today, were held at WAVES Summit 2025 in Mumbai. Take a look at the winners here.

Kolkata honours Satyajit Ray with crowdfunded street museumKolkata unveils a unique crowdfunded street museum to honour Satyajit Ray. This initiative marks a significant cultural tribute to the legendary filmmaker on his 104th birth anniversary.

Salman Khan's films go wrong as he tries to accommodate friends: Shehzad KhanVeteran actor Shehzad Khan calls out criticism against Salman Khan, highlighting his generosity, loyalty, and enduring mass appeal. He shared the screen with the superstar in 'Andaz Apna Apna', which was recently re-released in theatres.

Virat Kohli calls Nee Singam Dhan his favourite song, actor Simbu reactsDuring a recent chat show, cricketing superstar Virat Kohli revealed that his favourite song right now was AR Rahman's 'Nee Singham Dhan' from the Tamil film 'Pathu Thala' starring Silambarasan TR aka Simbu.

Kiara Advani to walk the MET Gala 2025 red carpet wearing Gaurav GuptaSoon-to-be mother Kiara Advani is set to make her Met Gala debut in 2025 in a custom Gaurav Gupta outfit. She will be joined by Shah Rukh Khan, Diljit Dosanjh, and Priyanka Chopra, marking a grand moment for Indian stars on the global fashion stage.

Alia Bhatt to join Aishwarya Rai, Eva Longoria for Cannes red carpet debutAlia Bhatt is set to make her Cannes Film Festival debut. She will join the roster of Loreal global ambassadors, including Aishwarya Rai and Eva Longoria among others.

After Paresh Rawal, Anu Aggarwal claims she drank her urine: It's amritActor Anu Aggarwal came out in support of veteran actor Paresh Rawal's claims about the health benefits of drinking one's own urine. During a recent event, she revealed that she had also tried it herself and claimed that there were anti-aging effects on her skin.
Anil Kapoor's mother Nirmal dies at 90Actor Anil Kapoor's mother Nirmal Kapoor died on May 2. She was 90 years old.

MET Gala 2025: Priyanka Chopra will make fifth appearance in Balmain and BulgariPriyanka Chopra Jonas is set to return to the MET Gala 2025 for the fifth time. She will join a star-studded lineup as the event celebrates the legacy of Black style with the theme 'Superfine: Tailoring Black Style.'

Lost In Starlight: South Korea's bet to turn global spotlight on their animation'Lost in Starlight' is marking a significant leap in the South Korean entertainment industry by being Netflix's first Korean animated film. With the global reach, will the spotlight now turn on South Korean animation?

Veteran actor Mumtaz, SRK's first crush, says no to playing his mother in filmsVeteran actor Mumtaz said she won't play Shah Rukh Khan's mother in films, as she wants roles that match her age and looks. She appreciated SRK's praise but added that she chooses roles that fit her style and image.

Fawad Khan, Atif Aslam's Instagram blocked in India after Hania Aamir, MahiraPakistani artistes Fawad Khan and Atif Aslam's Instagram accounts have been blocked in India after Hania Aamir and Mahira Khan. This comes after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

Akshay Kumar, Saif to reunite for edge-of-the-seat thriller after 17 years: ReportActors Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan are set to reunite on screen after 17 years. The two shared screen space in 'Tashan' (2008).

general news.headline: 7 killed, over 30 injured in stampede at Goa's Lairai Devi templeAt least 7 people were killed and over 30 injured after a stampede during the Shri Lairai Zatra in Goa's Shirgao.

Pakistan violates LoC ceasefire for 9th straight night, Army respondsSince the night of April 24, just hours after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty following the killing of 26 people in the terror attack, Pakistani troops have been resorting to unprovoked firing at various places along the LoC in J&K, beginning from the Kashmir Valley.

After PM, Rajnath Singh likely to skip Russia's Victory Day parade on May 9Defence Minister Rajnath Singh may not attend Russia's Victory Day celebrations on May 9 in Moscow. Minister of State (MoS) for Defence Sanjay Seth is expected to represent India at the annual event.

Pak seeks Gulf allies' help to ease tension with India over Pahalgam terror attackAfter the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif reached out to Gulf envoys, hoping to ease rising tensions with India. He sought support during a deeply sensitive time.

Prince Harry seeks Royal reconciliation, says King Charles won't speak to himPrince Harry has expressed a desire for reconciliation with the Royal Family, admitting to a strained relationship with King Charles III following a legal defeat over UK security arrangements, which he said left him 'devastated'.

Pak minister's X account blocked in India days after 'India will strike' claimThe X account of Pakistan minister Ataullah Tarar, who claimed that India may soon conduct a military strike on Pakistan, citing "credible intelligence" has been blocked in India. The move comes amid tensions between both countries over the Pahalgam terror attack.

Bangladesh should occupy Northeast states if India attacks Pak: Yunus' aideBangladesh Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus's aide suggested that if India attacks Pakistan, Bangladesh should occupy the northeastern states of India and initiate talks with China for a joint military arrangement.

Case against Ajaz Khan, producer of 'House Arrest' over obscene clipThe webshow, hosted by actor Ajaz Khan and streamed on the Ullu app, has sparked a controversy and even drawn political ire for alleged obscene content.

Un-bull-ievable: Watch bull takes scooter for a spin in RishikeshA bull unexpectedly sat on a parked scooter and moved the vehicle with its legs as if the animal was driving in Rishikesh. The 'joyride', however, lasted for a few seconds, when the bull crashed the scooter into a wall and later wandered off.

Rafale, Sukhoi jets land under moonlight in historic night drill on UP expresswayThe Indian Air Force (IAF) landed fighter jets on a 3.5-km Ganga Expressway stretch in Uttar Pradesh, testing combat readiness and night operations on India's first 27*7 expressway airstrip.

Watch: Tour van, pickup truck burst into flames after collision in US, killing 7Seven people were killed and eight injured in a fiery crash between a pickup truck and a tour van near Yellowstone National Park. The officials have yet to determine what caused the crash.

Bhopal students' rape accused shot in leg in late-night police encounterPolice said the accused stopped the vehicle on the pretext of going to the washroom and snatched a sub-inspector's pistol, and tried to escape. During the chaos, he was shot in the right leg.

From music to filmmaking: Create in India Challenge awards winners at WAVES 2025The Waves Create in India Challenge Awards, in partnership with India Today, were held at WAVES Summit 2025 in Mumbai. Take a look at the winners here.

Exercise restraint: EU and Switzerland to India, Pak amid tensions over J&K attackThe European Union and Switzerland expressed concern over the escalation of tensions between India and Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack and urged both sides to exercise restraint, and maintain peace in the region.

Watch: Kamala Harris dances to 'Boots on the Ground' at San Francisco galaA video of Kamala Harris dancing to the viral "Boots on the Ground" trend is winning hearts online. Filmed at a San Francisco gala, the clip shows a lighter side of Harris after her 2024 election loss, sparking joy and conversation on social media.

Mike Waltz seen using less-secure version of Signal during White House meetingNew photos show ex-Trump adviser Mike Waltz using a modified Signal app called TM SGNL during a cabinet meeting. The app allows message archiving. Top officials like Vance and Rubio were also part of the conversation.

Elon Musk on leaving DOGE: 'Is Buddha needed for Buddhism?'Elon Musk compared himself to Buddha while discussing the future of DOGE, saying it will thrive even after he steps back. Though his official role ends May 30, Musk plans to continue advising part-time, as long as the president wants him to.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Time to teach Pak a lesson: Congress resolution on Pahalgam terror attackThe Congress Working Committee, the party's highest decision-making body, passed a resolution condemning the Pahalgam terror attack and stressed that the time had come to "teach Pakistan a lesson" for its support of cross-border terrorism.

Harvard President calls Trump's tax threat 'highly illegal' amid funding clashHarvard President Alan Garber slammed Donald Trump's plan to revoke the university's tax-exempt status, calling it 'highly illegal' and politically motivated. He warned the move could threaten all higher education institutions.

'Make America Relax Again': White House's Lo-Fi MAGA video goes viralThe White House released a "Lo-Fi MAGA Video to Relax/Study To," featuring a cartoon-styled Trump character, campaign promises, and calm music—sparking praise online as creative PR targeting younger voters.

Sunrisers Hyderabad can still qualify for IPL 2025 playoffs. Here's howIPL 2025, GT vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad can still enter the playoffs through the backdoor despite their 38-run loss to the Gujarat Titans at the Narendra Modi Stadium.

Indian astronaut goes through emergency training ahead of Ax-4 launchIndian Air Force officer and astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla has completed emergency training ahead of the landmark Ax-4 mission -- a joint endeavour by Axiom Space, Nasa, Isro, and SpaceX.

EPS to be chief ministerial face for 2026 Tamil Nadu polls: AIADMK resolutionThe AIADMK passed a resolution batting for Edappadi K Palaniswami as the chief ministerial candidate for next year's Tamil Nadu Assembly polls and welcoming the inclusion of BJP and other like-minded parties opposed to DMK.

sports.headline: Prasidh Krishna 2.0 gears up for England tour after swinging success in IPL 2025After taking IPL 2025 by storm, Gujarat Titans pacer Prasidh Krishna is now gearing up for India's demanding red-ball tour of England. With the control he displayed throughout the tournament, he has positioned himself as one of India's most promising pace options.

Still on vacation mode, SRH all but knocked out of IPL 2025SunRisers Hyderabad were hammered by Gujarat Titans on May 2, in IPL 2025. SRH players failed to grasp the pace of the game after their week-long vacation at the Maldives.

Rs 199 to Rs 44,999: Neeraj Chopra Classic's tickets go liveTickets for the Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025, set for May 24 at Bengaluru's Sree Kanteerava Stadium, are now available. The javelin throw event will begin at 6:30 PM IST, with gates opening at 5 PM.

Sunrisers Hyderabad can still qualify for IPL 2025 playoffs. Here's howIPL 2025, GT vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad can still enter the playoffs through the backdoor despite their 38-run loss to the Gujarat Titans at the Narendra Modi Stadium.

IPL 2025: All round Gujarat Titans too hot to handle for Sunrisers HyderabadIPL 2025: Gujarat Titans outclassed Sunrisers Hyderabad in all departments to secure a 38-run win and deal a heavy blow to SRH's playoff aspirations. Shubman Gill's calm anchor role proved decisive in contrast to SRH's disjointed approach with the bat.

RCB are favourites to win the IPL 2025 title: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has declared Royal Challengers Bengaluru as the favourites to win IPL 2025. Their consistent performance, especially in away matches, sets them ahead in the race.

Devdutt Padikkal not feeling any pressure in experienced RCB batting lineupIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Devdutt Padikkal emphasised that he is not feeling any pressure of being part of teh side;s lineupo which boasts massive experience in the likes of Virat Kohli and even Phil Salt.

Rashid Khan takes stunning running catch to remove Travis HeadRashid Khan pulled off one of the catches of IPL 2025 on Friday (May 2), dismissing Travis Head during the Gujarat Titans vs Sunrisers Hyderabad clash at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

Club World Cup: FIFA to debut body cameras for refereesFIFA has announced that referees at the Club World Cup will wear body cameras and adhere to new rules. This move aims to enhance transparency and add a unique point of view to the broadcast.
Consistent Sai Sudharsan beats Sachin Tendulkar to elite recordSai Sudharsan's blistering innings against SunRisers Hyderabad saw him become the fastest Indian to 2000 T20 runs.

Ben Stokes returns from injury as England announce squad for one-off TestEngland captain Ben Stokes has returned to the Test side after recovering from his hamstring surgery. Stokes is fit to lead England in their one-off Test match against Zimbabwe.

Devdutt Padikkal not feeling any pressure in experienced RCB batting lineupIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Devdutt Padikkal emphasised that he is not feeling any pressure of being part of teh side;s lineupo which boasts massive experience in the likes of Virat Kohli and even Phil Salt.

Rashid Khan takes stunning running catch to remove Travis HeadRashid Khan pulled off one of the catches of IPL 2025 on Friday (May 2), dismissing Travis Head during the Gujarat Titans vs Sunrisers Hyderabad clash at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

Club World Cup: FIFA to debut body cameras for refereesFIFA has announced that referees at the Club World Cup will wear body cameras and adhere to new rules. This move aims to enhance transparency and add a unique point of view to the broadcast.
Consistent Sai Sudharsan beats Sachin Tendulkar to elite recordSai Sudharsan's blistering innings against SunRisers Hyderabad saw him become the fastest Indian to 2000 T20 runs.

Ben Stokes returns from injury as England announce squad for one-off TestEngland captain Ben Stokes has returned to the Test side after recovering from his hamstring surgery. Stokes is fit to lead England in their one-off Test match against Zimbabwe.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
